gameobject

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameobject.GameObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Animal, Camera, Measure, Sand

    public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    GameObject is an abstract class representing items that are drawn to the screen. This includes any Animal collected in the game, the research tools, and some environment assets.
    Author:
    W Mathieu Mimms-Boyce, Miguel Fuentes
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameObject

        public GameObject(int xPos,
                  int yPos,
                  int depth,
                  int xSize,
                  int ySize,
                  java.lang.String imagePath)
        The constructor for GameObject.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x cooridnate of the object.

        xPos = 0;

        defaults to the upper left corner.

        yPos - The y coordinate of the object.

        yPos = 0;

        defaults to the upper left corner.

        depth - The order the object will be drawn.

        depth = 0;

        is drawn first with higher numbers being drawn last.

        xSize - The horizontal scale of the object.
        ySize - The vertical scale of the object.
        imagePath - The path to the sprite of the object.

    • Method Detail

      • clickedOn

        public boolean clickedOn(int clickX,
                         int clickY)
        clickedOn evaluates whether coordinates passed on have resulted in the object being clicked on. The parameters passed in check the object's size to evaluate whether the click fell within its bounds or not.
        Parameters:
        clickX - The x coordinate of the click
        clickY - The y coordinate of the click
        Returns:
        true if the object was clicked on, else false

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        This method will be called on every tick of our timer in the Controller. However the object is expected to change per tick is to be defined in this method.

        If the object does not move, its update method should be empty.
